result.execSummary:
The defendant Severian Armstrong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
05-24-2016/ Judge Mark A Sanders
The Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,200.00, payable to Walgreens; restitution is joint & several with Wayman T Green. and Anthony O Poorman.  Restitution is to be collected by the DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis Stats.
Restitution is to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges and/ or fines.
Failure to pay by the end of extended supervision will result in a civil judgment. 
**  **  **  **  **  **  

Hearing May 24, 2016.

Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so.
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA surcharge.
DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds. Balance as condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Full time employment, or part time employment and school, or full time school.

No Contact Order with the following:  Rhoneysha F., James B., Javon R., address of 6707 W. Hampton Avenue City of MIlwaukee; the coactors Waymon Green or Anthony Poorman.
No firearms.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant  he cannot possess firearms; and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Severian Armstrong in court via video conference with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Severian Armstrong in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,200.00 payable to Walgreens joint and several with Waymon T. Green and Anthony O. Poorman. Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges, and/or fines. Failure to pay by the end of extended supervision will result in civil judgment.
Restitution hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Severian Armstrong in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  Corrections made to the presentence investigation report.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  4 and 1/2 years with  172  days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  24 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  30 months.  

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  Restitution to be determined at restitution hearing
-  No Contact Order with Rhoneysha F.,   AND/OR  James B.,   AND/OR   Javon W.
-  No Contact Order with the address of  6707 West Hampton Avenue, City of Milwaukee
-  No Contact Order with the co-actors Waymon Green  AND/OR  Anthony Poorman
-  No firearms
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Court orders case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 28.  Milwaukee County video technician confirmed availability for video conference on the next date.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated April 8, 2016 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Alternative Presentence Investigation Report received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Parties stipulate that bail had been previously set at $13,000.
Therefore, Court orders an additional $750 to be posted.

Defendant taken into custody.

State requests remand pending sentencing.  Defense objects.  Arguments to the court.
Court will modify bail.

Defendant Severian Armstrong in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI ordered without recommendation.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.

Defendant Severian Armstrong in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Severian Armstrong in custody.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
